page.title: 18RELIGION-PATRONAL FESTIVAL
page.content:
THE PARISH OF ALL SAINTS IN GREAT HORKESLEY-JULY 1985.
THE PARISH OF ALL SAINTS(WITH ST. JOHNS)HELD A SUCCESSFUL WEEKEND EVENT,BEGINNING WITH A FAMILY PARTY IN THE BISHOP WILLIAM WARD HALL.A MEAL WAS SERVED TO ABOUT 100 VISITORS,AND THIS WAS FOLLOWED WITH ENTERTAINMENT WITH THE WYVENAIRS.THEIR SONGS BROUGHT BACK MEMORIES OF THE OLD TIME MUSIC HALL TO SOME,WHILE THE YOUNGER AUDIENCE SOON JOINED IN THE SPIRIT OF THINGS.ON SUNDAY,THE FESTIVAL WAS MARKED BY A SPECIAL SERVICE OF FAMILY COMMUNION AT ALL SAINTS,THE PREACHER BEING THE REVERAND DAVIES FROM BRAINTREE.THE RECTOR THANKED ALL THOSE WHO PARTICIPATED IN THE WEEKEND TO MAKE IT SUCH A SUCCESS.ALTHOUGH NOT PRIMARILY A FUND-RAISING EVENT,THE SUM OF Â£340 WAS RAISED.
